reviewText: Mostly a visual treat, but since there is no story line, may prove boring to some, while others might be mesmerized. I, a 3-D practitioner and fan enjoyed every moment.  Understandably, the etherial music and free-flowing forms may put others to sleep.
extremely good 3d, but also extremely redundant

I am a 3D TV fanatic!
This disc is phenomenal!!  I am writing this for all existing 3D TV fanatics and to anyone who is contemplating owning a 3D TV.  And especially to anyone who is disappointed in the 3D-ness of their 3D TV.  The video and sound are the best produced I have ever experienced.  If you want to see what your 3D TV is capable of.....Buy it!  You will experience from infinite depth to smack-you-in-the-face video. It will demonstrate what can be done with 3D TV if only the producers of 3D BD media would bother to show competence in their field.  The audio will test your system from floor shaking bass to treble as high as I can hear.  And probably higher. The content consists of varying moving shapes. That's it!!  No story.  Nothing you would recognize.  Just a demonstration of 3D video and sonic excellence.  I will never doubt my equipment again after seeing this.  Only the media I put into it.

Andrew's 3D Blu-ray Review: 3D MASTERPIECES are the new 3D Blu-ray conceptual series of prestigious Blu-ray 3D Labels "3D Content Hub." With the well-known and internationally acclaimed Canadian artist SAN BASE publishes 3D MASTERPIECES the first edition of the series, which presents in future ground-breaking digital artists with its internationally award-winning 3D animation and art works.

Function of Reality allows you to relax your mind and release your stress as you flow through each world and become totally immersed within this ever changing journey. Many forms of meditation exist, but in the realm of audio and video, SAN BASE has delivered a meditative experience that leaves a lasting impression. Invention of Dynamic Painting: The concept of Dynamic Painting was discovered almost by fluke. The economic collapse of the former USSR in the nineties had a devastating effect on all aspects of life. Art supplies such as brushes, paints and canvas became hard to come by. One day, San Base managed to stock up on paints, but he could not find canvases, not even pieces of throwaway cardboards to paint on. It occurred to him that since he drew for his own pleasure, he could just paint over his old pieces of work.

As they say, necessity is the mother of all inventions. When SAN BASE started painting over his old works, he noticed something peculiar about the way he was doing it. While painting over the old images, SAN BASE always subconsciously tried to select colours in such a way, that the latest work in progress would always harmonise with the old image being painted over. This phenomenon seemed intriguing to him, so he purposefully began transforming the same picture over and over again, achieving interesting results in the process. The paintings attained another dimension - the dimension of time. But the process itself was too laborious; the paints and canvas were far from being an ideal platform for implementing the newly discovered concept. It occurred to SAN BASE that a computer or TV screen would be a much better device for bringing pictures to life than a real canvas. This is where his computer engineering background came in handy. SAN BASE put the brushes aside and started developing a program that could help him automate the image generation and transformation. The new medium was born.

3D Masterpieces Vol. 1 San Base: Function of Reality presents SAN BASE "stereoscopic' 3D real experience of a special kind: Enchanted 3D parallel worlds, psychedelic coral reefs and crystal caves, breath-taking landscapes. SAN BASE developed like no other fantastic, himself constantly evolving 3D worlds with stunning Pop out 3D effects in an unprecedented spatial depth. One has to take this in perspective. It is a combination of music mixed in surround with a computer generated images. If I had no reference to compare with, I'd say it is a nice example of 3D imaginary with 5.1 music. Some kind of a modern impressionism, if you will. However, by coincidence, I watched it on the same day and right after I watched Lichtmond 2 - Universe of Light. The difference in artistic level, quality of music, and quality of computer generated imaginary is striking.  After the beauty of Lichtmond, the music of this album sounds simplistic, and 3D graphics feels outright boring and primitive. This is a disk which is worth seeing, but it is not the best in its genre.

The video is not even an attempt to create an imaginary world. It is some kind of fractal design video, which shows 3D patterns which follow a certain structure and shape, but appear to be fairly random.

I was not impressed.
Amazing, clever visuals - really make me appreciate the 3D aspects of my TV.  Can't recommend this DVD enough - and I'm a tough sell!
